comments:
build 2002-03-28 on Win98.

I got this exception printed to the log file on startup. Debug configurations 
were turned on, although in the previous session I had turned them off, ran a 
program as a Java app, and then turned them back on.

Joe, do we know why this is happenning?
Can duplicate log, but not sure what's going on.

Simple test case:
- Fresh workspace
- Set pref to launcher-style
- Import something and launch 
it
- Change pref to config-style
- Exit workbench
- Restarting workbench generates walkback in 
log

Fixed in DebugUIPlugin.setEmptyLaunchHistories().  Problem was that on a property change for 
the launching preference, we were resetting the histories, but NOT clearing the most recent 
launch field.  This resulted in writing out bogus XML to the history file on shutdown, which caused 
a parse error on startup.  I think this little problem may have been the root cause of several other 
'XML parse error' bugs that were logged in regards to launch configs.

traces.message: The root element is required in a well-formed  document.
